author: Special Correspondent
text:
Move aims to increase turnout of women; officials analysing stations with low voting percentage

In addition to 64 model polling stations, the Chennai District Election Office plans to commission all-woman polling stations in 16 locations during the Assembly elections.

At a meeting on Saturday, Chennai District Election Officer B. Chandra Mohan directed Electoral Registration Officers and Returning Officers to identify a polling station in each constituency. All the presiding officers, polling officers, micro-observers and police there will be women.

“Officials are studying the polling stations that recorded low turnout of women during the last elections,” said an official. “Saidapet had the lowest turnout in 2014. We will commission the facilities based on the analysis of such data,” said an official. During previous elections, officials provided AC facilities, trained staff to be extra courteous and offered buttermilk to voters in the five model polling stations in Kolathur, Nungambakkam, Guindy and Adyar.
title: 16 all-woman polling stations in Chennai district
